tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE sensor_data (
  sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_value FLOAT,
  sensor_timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE SensorData (
    data_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    value FLOAT,
    FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES Sensors(sensor_id)
);

CREATE TABLE SensorAnalysis (
    analysis_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    analysis_type STRING,
    result STRING,
    FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES Sensors(sensor_id)
);

CREATE TABLE SensorTrends (
    trend_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    analysis_id INT,
    trend_name STRING,
    trend_description STRING,
    FOREIGN KEY (analysis_id) REFERENCES SensorAnalysis(analysis_id)
);

CREATE TABLE sensor_data (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
 sensor_name VARCHAR(50),
 sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
 sensor_value DECIMAL,
 timestamp TIMESTAMP,
 location VARCHAR(100))

CREATE TABLE sensor_data_summary (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
 sensor_id INT,
 summary_type VARCHAR(50),
 min_value DECIMAL,
 max_value DECIMAL,
 avg_value DECIMAL)

CREATE TABLE sensor_location (location_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
 location_name VARCHAR(100),
 region VARCHAR(50),
 country VARCHAR(50))

CREATE TABLE sensor_type (type_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
 type_name VARCHAR(50),
 category VARCHAR(50))

CREATE TABLE sensor_alerts (alert_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
 sensor_id INT,
 alert_type VARCHAR(50),
 alert_message TEXT,
 alert_time TIMESTAMP)
